alert.note: Alert for De Soto; Natchitoches; Sabine (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 23 at 3:49PM CST until January 23 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern De Soto Parish in northwestern Louisiana... West Central Natchitoches Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northwestern Sabine Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northwestern Sabine County in eastern Texas... Northeastern San Augustine County in eastern Texas... Eastern Shelby County in eastern Texas... * Until 700 PM CST. * At 349 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mansfield, Milam, Zwolle, Converse, Patroon, Shelbyville, Neuville, Bland Lake, Oak Grove, Pleasant Hill, Huxley, South Mansfield, Noble, Grand Cane, Stanley, Toledo Bend Reservoir North, Jordans Store, Sexton, Hurstown and Pelican. This includes the following streams and drainages... Palo Gaucho Bayou, Big Iron Ore Creek, Brady Creek, Prairie Creek, Sabine River, Yellow Branch, Cypress Bayou, Brawley Creek, Na Bonchasse, Bayou, Spring Creek, Tenaha Creek, Duke Bayou, Rascal Creek, McDonald Bayou, Butler Creek, Bourghs Creek, Tenmile Bayou, Canadian Bayou, Liton Branch, Prairie Bayou, Baget Creek, Scie, Bayou, Brushy Bayou, Chambers Creek, Stinkfinger Creek, Fraigeson Creek, Allen Creek, Flat Fork Creek, Hollis Creek, Reeves Creek, Lick Creek, Buffalo Bayou, Perkins Creek, Bossier Bayou, Sulphur Creek, Buckley Creek, Louies Bayou, Wallace Creek, Blanchard Bayou, San Miguel, Bayou, Boregas Creek, Beauchamp Creek, Cow Bayou, Heart Bayou, Wooten Creek, Lost Bayou, Belle Bayou, El Lobanillo Creek, Siphorien Bayou, Mustang Creek, Jackson Creek, Cook Creek, Thompson Creek, Clement Creek, Siep, Bayou, Caney Creek, Tiger Creek, Carrizo Creek, West Branch Dolet Bayou, Pierre, Bayou, Huana Creek, Mill Creek, Grannies Creek, Boyd Creek, Chatman Bayou, Dry Bayou, South Bayou Blue, Castor, Bayou, Bull Bay Creek, Patroon Bayou, San Miguel Creek, Ayish Bayou, Jims River, Higgenbotham Branch, McGrue Creek, Wallace Bayou, North Bayou Blue, Morrison Creek, Bayou San Patricio and Bear Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
